mvp.listener

Interface ListenerDialog

  • All Superinterfaces:
    java.awt.event.ActionListener, java.util.EventListener, ListenerView
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractListenerDialog

    public interface ListenerDialog
extends ListenerView
    Interface extending the ListenerView interface and adding methods specifically intended for dialog implementations. The main purpose of this interface is to allow dialogs to best utilize the ListenerView API, and so the documentations for that super-interface should be consulted before implementing this interface.

    In addition to the ListenerView methods, this interface provides four dialog-specific methods that will need to be implemented. showDialog() and hideDialog() display and dispose of the dialog window respectively. setModal(boolean) and getModal() deal with the modality of the dialog, and allow it to be determined and changed if necessary.

    NOTE: External listeners to receive ActionEvents should be added to instances of ListenerDialog before the showDialog() method is invoked. For maximum flexibility, AbstractListenerView has been designed to also serve as a listener for dialogs implementing this interface, in case the dialog is created within a GUI class and can't add the controller directly as an ActionListener. If AbstractListenerView receives an ActionEvent from this dialog, it will safely pass it along to the controller without changing its source.

    THREAD SAFETY: Swing is NOT thread safe, and all operations on the dialogs inheriting this interface must be done from the EventDispatchThread

    Version:
    2.0
    Author:
    craig
    See Also:
    AbstractListenerView

      • Methods inherited from interface mvp.listener.ListenerView

    • Method Detail

      • showDialog

        void showDialog()
        Display the dialog in the GUI. The dialog should not be visible prior to invoking this method, as this provides time for the dialog to be configured prior to it being displayed.

      • closeDialog

        void closeDialog()
        Close the dialog when it is no longer needed.

      • getModal

        boolean getModal()
        Get whether or not this dialog is modal.
        Returns:
        true if this dialog is modal.

      • setModal

        void setModal(boolean modal)
        Set the modality of this dialog.
        Parameters:
        modal - whether or not this dialog is modal.
